common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 Issues: LTM, Performance, and Chrome Plugin
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2, including LTM repeatedly turning off on macOS, performance problems and unresponsiveness in VSCode on Windows, and Chrome plugin connection failures with reported outdated version despite having the latest (4.0.9) from the store.

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Failed to connect to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Failed to connect to PiecesOS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome plugin doesn't work properly. I can't use the buttons and features, and the sidebar cannot establish connection either. Inside of Pieces desktop app it shows that the chrome plugin is outdated. However this is the newest I got from the chrome app store.

Plugin version: 4.0.9

common_issues.title: Pieces OS connectivity issues across VS Code and Chrome extensions
common_issues.description: Users report various connectivity problems with Pieces OS on Windows.  VS Code extension fails to connect, showing errors in developer tools and Pieces OS logs. Chrome extension malfunctions, reporting outdated version despite being the latest. Common symptoms include empty settings windows, unresponsive buttons, and general sluggishness in VS Code when Pieces OS is active.  Suggested solutions include checking custom URL settings for remote environments and ensuring proper communication between Pieces OS and extensions.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 bugs on Windows
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2 on Windows, including memory creation failure via MCP, intermittent connection drops, VSCode performance degradation, and image pasting failures. Some issues are resolved in 11.4.3.  Users should update to the latest version. Further investigation is needed for persistent issues.

related_issues.title: bug: create memory via mcp(resolved in next release 11.4.3)

The issue is that whenever copilot tries to use the create_memory_pieces tool it fails. related_issues.title: Pasting images doesn't work.
related_issues.text:
Pasting images doesn't work.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I paste an image, and I get after a while the "Uuups..." error response. GPT4.1 one tries to read the contents but fails. So pasting doesn't work.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and VS Code/Chrome extensions, especially on Windows.
Investigate and address the root cause of LTM repeatedly turning off on macOS.
Address the performance issues in VS Code when Pieces OS is active on Windows.
Ensure the Chrome extension update mechanism is working correctly and users are informed of updates.
Monitor and address any remaining issues with image pasting and memory creation via MCP on Windows after the 11.4.3 update.
Proactively communicate known issues and solutions to users through release notes or support documentation.
Gather more data on the frequency and impact of reported issues to better prioritize future development efforts.
Consider implementing automated testing to catch compatibility issues between Pieces OS, extensions, and different operating systems before release.
Improve error messaging and logging to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution of user-reported problems.
Create a dedicated support channel or forum for users to report issues and receive assistance.
Collect user feedback on the effectiveness of proposed solutions and identify areas for improvement in the support process.
Analyze support ticket trends over time to identify recurring issues and potential areas for proactive intervention.
Develop internal troubleshooting guides and knowledge base articles to empower support staff to quickly resolve common issues.
Train support staff on the latest features and updates to Pieces OS and related extensions.
Implement a system for tracking and prioritizing bug fixes based on user impact and frequency of reports.
Regularly review and update support documentation to ensure it is accurate and comprehensive.
Consider offering remote assistance or screen sharing options to help users troubleshoot complex issues.
Encourage users to submit detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce the issue, screenshots, and relevant logs.
Implement a system for escalating complex or critical issues to the development team for prompt resolution.
Monitor social media and online forums for mentions of Pieces OS issues and proactively engage with users to offer support and gather feedback.
Conduct user surveys to assess satisfaction with the support process and identify areas for improvement.
Analyze support ticket resolution times to identify bottlenecks and optimize the support workflow.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for responding to and resolving support tickets.
Automate routine support tasks, such as ticket routing and initial responses, to free up support staff to focus on more complex issues.
Implement a system for tracking user feedback and suggestions for product improvements.
Regularly review and analyze support metrics to identify trends, measure performance, and drive continuous improvement in the support process.
Foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the support team.
Encourage collaboration between support and development teams to ensure seamless communication and efficient issue resolution.
